Package org.cesecore.keys.validation

Class EccKeyValidator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.internal.UpgradeableDataHashMap
      • org.cesecore.profiles.ProfileBase
        • org.cesecore.keys.validation.ValidatorBase
          • org.cesecore.keys.validation.KeyValidatorBase
            • org.cesecore.keys.validation.EccKeyValidator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, IUpgradeableData, CertificateProfileAwareValidator, KeyValidator, PhasedValidator, Validator, ValidityAwareValidator, Profile, DynamicUiModelAware
    public class EccKeyValidator
extends KeyValidatorBase
    Default ECC key validator using the Bouncy Castle BCECPublicKey implementation (see org.bouncycastle.jcajce.provider.asymmetric.ec.BCECPublicKey). The key validator is used to implement the CA/B-Forum requirements for RSA public key quality requirements, including FIPS 186-4 and NIST (SP 800-89 and NIST SP 56A: Revision 2) requirements. See: https://cabforum.org/wp-content/uploads/CA-Browser-Forum-BR-1.4.2.pdf section 6.1.6
    Version:
    $Id: EccKeyValidator.java 29467 2018-07-05 16:23:04Z mikekushner $
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • validate

        public List<String> validate​(PublicKey publicKey,
                             CertificateProfile certificateProfile)
                      throws ValidatorNotApplicableException,
                             ValidationException
        Description copied from interface: KeyValidator
        Method that validates the public key.
        Parameters:
        publicKey - the public key to validate.
        certificateProfile - the Certificate Profile as input for validation
        Returns:
        the error messages or an empty list if the public key was validated successfully.
        Throws:
        ValidatorNotApplicableException - when this validator is not applicable for the input, for example ECC keys as input to an RSA key validator
        ValidationException - if the certificate issuance MUST be aborted.
